comments.commentBody:
Does the US get any dividends for resurrecting this country with the
lives of its young, and billions and billions of tax dollars that go into the pockets of the corrupt few ? ..that is, do we get any stake in the copper underneath ? small payback, but at least it's something...

What happened to the original date?  Just who is dumb enough to think things in Afghanistan will be any better in 2014 after Billions of Dollars get poured down that rat-hole and hundreds or thousands of American troops die over there.

There are many of us who do not want American soldiers in Afganistan.  We do not want to fund a war for 4 more years.  We want the investment made in our economy and to businesses that support our economy.
And just how long after 2014 will the occupation continue using mercenaries and "non-combat" troops?

Fat chance. since the Afghan constitution is Muslim fundamentalist, the Taliban will come over, and doing what they, the Taliban, do best. Muslim fundamentalism, also known as Salafism.

There is no way the White House is so dim that they have no figured that one out. Hence they lie: first 2011, now 2014, soon, 2041…. The American People, like the proverbial frog and the rest of the planet, shall simmer slowly. and the military-industrial complex shall thrive ever more.
http://patriceayme.wordpress.com/

Out by 2014 huh? Let's see by Washington DC math that is 2027.
Of course 2027 when we start the 'phased' with drawl.

Nothing surprises me anymore. I've seen all their shell games.

Why bother if there is no distinguishable victory or resolution..

The Taliban cannot be negotiated with only defeated or allowed to exist and proliferate and expand throughout the region...

If you've read or studied The Quran you know any truce or agreement with their enemy is meaningless and only a tactic...
Barack Obama:  One-term President.

This is unacceptable. Why are we cutting funding to schools? Why are we closing libraries? Why are we asking our First Responders to work for chicken-feed?
This is another total fiasco.

Here we go, cutting and running--er, slipsliding and backpedaling over three years--again. Did Mr. Obama get a break for signing up for three years instead of pulling out by 2011 like he--er--promised?  New slogan--'Nothing You Can Believe In.'

I'm a big Obama supporter.  Will be with him 100% in 12', and the Dems.  But of course I'm American first and war transcends party sypathies.  That being said though I can live with this timeline.  Barely.  But I can live with it.  As long as its firm and there are no major delays in implementing it, if this is what they need I guess I can support it.  But I'd feel better about 2012 or 2013 personally.....
One more promise President Obama made that is to be broken.  We had such hope.  No wonder the glow has faded.

We shouldn't be there at all because Taliban played no role in planning or executing the attacks of 9/11 and even if bin Laden were found he is mostly likely dead by now or on his death bed.  The source of militant Islam comes from the brand of Islam taught in and spread from Saudi Arabia not from Iraq or from Taliban.  President Obama said the Iraq war was a "mistake" and if that is so then the war against Taliban is an even bigger mistake turning a greater portion of the Islamic world against the U.S. and in the process getting NATO allies angry at U.S. for leading them into this war provoked by U.S. foreign policies after their economies have taken a nose dive due to the U.S. caused housing bubble and foreclosure crisis.  All the while nothing is being done to address the source of militant Islam which is coming from Saudi Arabia where we are likely to see a long line of bin Laden types in the future!

Americans as well as citizens of other coalition countries were told we would begin a withdrawal in July 2011, at a rate determined by conditions on the ground. As long as this 2014 goal is in the context of the plan to being drawdown in July then I can accept it. But if more countries bail out in July and they want to increase American troops as a result that's not going to fly.

I truly hope such a plan comes to fruition but having to deal with the Jihad and other radical devious people groups, using barbaric tactics--not to mention terrorists, it would take nothing less than a miracle to accomplish the above plan of action.  THIS IS REALITY!

I thought the plan was to have all troops out by 2012? Well, what is a couple more years, a couple trillion dollars more and a couple hundred more lives of our troops in the grand schemes of things?

Mr. Karzai wants us out quickly so that he can complete the looting of Afghanistan, but the poor man has no idea what the Taliban have in store for him. The NATO forces are the greatest and most expensive mob protection force ever assembled. If Karzai and his mob family had any sense, which he does not have, he would keep them there forever.

There is not even the maintenance of a pretence anymore that Obama is the commander in chief.

Obama takes his orders from our perpetual war machine and acts accordingly.

How sad that is for our country.

They might be winding down the combat part, but they are building permanent bases there.  We have over 800 bases around the world.  When Katrina hit, I wonder if those people were not rescued because our equipment and the National Guard were overseas.  We are spread way too thin, and we are vulnerable because of it.  With our financial system having been hugely compromised, we are in a world of hurt right now.  On top of that our energy supply has peaked, and we are on the edge of an even bigger mess.  I've read that the U.S. military is preparing for peak oil, but nothing is being done for civilians.  This country cannot endure too much more irresponsibility for the greater good.
In 2014 there will be the 2018 plan to end combat.
FOUR MORE YEARS!?!?!  Start by explaining why we are there and what it costs.
So only a thirteen-year war?

are you kidding me??? another 4 years???
hasn't it been long enough? has not enough suffering happened yet??
what a good idea- putting the responsibility for a failed war policy on the republican president. Pay back for putting the democrats in the hole for the financial collapse.

2014...so soon? I mean, what's the rush?

One can only hope that, long after the last soldier leaves, we continue to pump money, and lots of it, down that rat hole. What would a 13 year long military failure be without the lingering hangover of another 15 year fiscal commitment to propping up one corrupt government after another?

It's the right thing to do.

Frankly, it bothers me, this reduction of the mind to a most intricate central processing network ... one that moldulates and coordinates our social and environmental interactions, and sometimes results in such intricate adaptations as creating, altering and using complex tools, including language. But where is consciousness to be found within this tremendous complex of neurophysiological activity? Wherefore our sensations, emotions, moods and passions? In all these signaling and cascading neurons, where is to be found the experiential, the subjective, the self? An intelligent color blind person may perfectly understand the behavior of the retina, the optic nerves, the structures & functions of the brain's optic centers, but, so long as he remains colorblind, he will never really know the meaning of 'blue' or 'red,' at least in terms of experience, of consciousness.

So it seems to me that Professir Sapolsky's conception of the brain --the mind?-- says nothing about the nature of consiousness, without which all of these breathtaking descriptions and explanations are of little value.
